sen.e: Tsurahide CHO (1856 - July 27, 1878) was a fuhei shizoku (former samurai with gripes) in the early Meiji period.

sen.e: With respect to Takamori SAIGO, he visited Kagoshima twice, a total of 14 months between 1873 and 1875; and he formed a relationship with Toshiaki KIRINO and Shinsuke BEPPU.

sen.e: He planned an assassination of Toshimitsu OKUBO along with 5 others including Ichiro SHIMADA and moved to Tokyo in November 1877.
